original_definition: 'Rated power' is a conventional value of apparent power assigned to a winding which, together with the rated voltage of the winding, determines its rated current.
generated_definition: 'Rated power' means the power output of a generating station or other power source, measured in watts or kilowatts, taking into account the maximum continuous output rating under standard conditions.

Article 2: ‘Rated power’ (Sr) is a conventional value of apparent power assigned to a winding which, together with the rated voltage of the winding, determines its rated current.
